author: potuz
content: The state of the light client is maintained in the `LightClientStore` structure that keeps track of the last finalized header, this structure gets updated with the appropriate header from the `LightClientUpdate`

author: shresth
content: If we don't want to know about the last finalised header then both the structures are not required?

content: Like if we are only interested to know about the tip of the chain which is `header`

author: potuz
content: The p2p aspects of light clients has not been finalized. I suggest you take a look at this proposal <https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/2802> that handles an optimistic sync for them.

author: potuz
content: Also <#595701319793377299> is a more appropriate channel as this one is mainly used by people writing an executable version of the execution specs
